column4: so, to upgrade to Hoary from Warty, is it as easy as s/warty/hoary/g in sources.list, then apt-get update && apt-get dist-upgrade?
essentially, save you'll want to use a mirror: http://64.233.187.104/search?q=cache:XmNbmphb-KMJ:www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/Archive+ubuntu+archive&hl=en
here.
add its name to /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-foo
I added it to /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist
what are you trying to blacklist?
ieee1394 ohci1394 eth1394 (already blacklisted) and sbp2
do you have a firewire controller?
firewire keeps my network from working... weird issue, I think it is my laptop's acpi implementation, causing troubles in non-windpipe OSes
yes, but I don't want drivers to be loaded for it
eth1394 is the culprit?
no, I believe it is ieee1394
I think what you want to test first is passing ignore_drivers=1 to modprobe ieee1394
can you please explain what that will do, and how I can pass that option to modprobe?
echo "options ieee1394 ignore_drivers=1" | sudo tee -a /etc/modprobe.d/ieee1394
a description can be found using modinfo ieee1394
ok, done, rebooting

thought udev was just like a devfs replacement...
udev+Linux 2.6.15's netlink.
netlink? ^_^ sorry, not too up-to-date with latest kernel features
